title: Dismissals at Justice Dept. Would Bypass Civil Service and Whistle-Blower Laws

summary: The three-judge panel has allowed the case to languish in a kind of legal limbo, catching the eye of some legal experts.

summary: The Consumer Price Index rose 2.7 percent from a year earlier, as the global trade war started to bite.

summary: JPMorgan’s chief, Jamie Dimon, lauded the “resilient” U.S. economy as his bank reported bumper quarterly earnings.

summary: The Trump administration is adding a 17 percent tariff to a year-round grocery store staple, while funneling more business to domestic tomato growers, largely in Florida.

summary: The century-old system faces infrastructure and climate challenges that are making its water problem worse.

summary: Passengers on an uptown No. 1 train saw floodwaters swamping the station at 28th Street and Seventh Avenue in Manhattan.

summary: After European leaders stepped up military spending, President Trump aligned himself more closely with them on the war. But his tariffs threats have left bruises.

summary: NATO allies will buy arms, then give them to Ukraine, President Trump said.

summary: Beijing will now require government licenses for any effort to transfer abroad the technologies crucial for producing inexpensive electric cars.
